required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prevention of Postpartum Weight Retention in Low Income WIC Women
clinical_study.official_title: Prevention of Postpartum Weight Retention in Low Income WIC Women

lead_sponsor.agency: California Polytechnic State University-San Luis Obispo

collaborator.agency: University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill

clinical_study.source: California Polytechnic State University-San Luis Obispo

brief_summary.textblock: This study will examine the effects of an online behavioral intervention to promote weight loss in low income postpartum women in the WIC program.

detailed_description.textblock: This program is designed to reduce postpartum weight retention in low income women in the WIC program. The weight loss program will be delivered over the internet and will use behavioral weight loss techniques.

primary_outcome.description: Women randomized to the weight loss group will be assessed at study entry, 6 months, and 12 months. Weight is the primary outcome

secondary_outcome.description: Behavioral and psychosocial variables will be measured at study entry, 6 and 12 months.

arm_group.description: This group will be allowed access to an online weight loss program. The program is designed to help low income women lose weight through lifestyle intervention.
The control group will received Standard Care as provided through WIC.

intervention.description: The intervention group will be given access to an online weight loss program supplemented by monthly group meetings.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Women
- Age 18-40 years.
- Delivery within 6-52 weeks
- Exceed pre-pregnancy weight by at least 4.5 kg (10 pounds) or current body mass index (BMI) >/= 25
- Current BMI > 22
- English or Spanish speaking
- Has internet access at home or a landline
- Literacy of at least 5th grade reading level
- Has a cell phone
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant or planning to become pregnant
- Relocating in the next year
- Serious psychological problems (untreated depression, schizophrenia, bipolar disorder) or medical problem (i.e. heart disease, cancer, renal disease and diabetes), for which physician supervision of diet and exercise prescription is needed.

overall_official.affiliation: California Polytechnic State University-San Luis Obispo

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: California Polytechnic State University-San Luis Obispo
